name: MatchBankTransaction
description:
Match an uncategorized bank transaction with an existing one.

Use this tool to match an uncategorized transaction with an existing transaction in Zoho Books, ensuring proper categorization and reconciliation.

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the organization in Zoho Books.

parameters.name: bank_transaction_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the bank transaction to be matched.

value_schema.description: Unique identifier of the bank transaction.

parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: The mandatory Account ID for listing transactions to match. This is required to specify the bank account in Zoho Books.

value_schema.description: Mandatory Account id for which transactions are to be listed.

parameters.name: transactions_to_be_matched
parameters.description: A JSON array of transactions to be matched, with each containing a transaction_id and transaction_type.

transaction_type.description:
Type of the transaction.
Allowed transaction types : deposit, refund(*Supported only in Credit Card accounts), transfer_fund, card_payment, sales_without_invoices, expense_refund, owner_contribution, interest_income, other_income, owner_drawings, sales_return
Note: You will not be able to create the following module-specific transaction types under Bank Transaction endpoints :
Expense, Vendor Advance/Vendor Payment/Bill Payment, Vendor Credit Refund, Vendor Payment Refund, Customer Advance/Customer Payment, Credit Note Refund, Payment Refund. Hence, refer them in their repective modules.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the zoho-books API.

parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: Mandatory Account id for which transactions are to be listed.

value_schema.description: Mandatory Account id for which transactions are to be listed.

parameters.name: transaction_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the bank transaction.

value_schema.description: Unique identifier of the bank transaction.

transaction_type.description:
Type of the transaction.
Allowed transaction types : deposit, refund(*Supported only in Credit Card accounts), transfer_fund, card_payment, sales_without_invoices, expense_refund, owner_contribution, interest_income, other_income, owner_drawings, sales_return
Note: You will not be able to create the following module-specific transaction types under Bank Transaction endpoints :
Expense, Vendor Advance/Vendor Payment/Bill Payment, Vendor Credit Refund, Vendor Payment Refund, Customer Advance/Customer Payment, Credit Note Refund, Payment Refund. Hence, refer them in their repective modules.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
